string.text: This area is off limits, stalker.
But I need to go there.
Tough luck, mate.\nUnless... If you REALLY need to go, the "fare" is 500.
Here you are.
Now listen up. We'll pretend for a moment it's nothing but mosquitoes and butterflies around here. What happens beyond this point is your own damn business.
Alright, keep moving! Get your ass outta here, before we change our mind.
I don't have that kind of money.
Then go back where you came from and get it. And don't you try and sneak past us, you hear? Trust me, it's not worth dying for.
Get out of here, Marked One. Walk away or crawl away, the choice is yours.
What's got into you?
Hi there. Whatcha need?
Our boss here wanted to see you. But that doesn't make you a welcome guest. Keep moving.
Hello, brother.
Pathfinder, I need to see Doctor.
Well, look at that. How do you know about Doctor?
Ghost sent me. Help me get in touch with Doctor. It's urgent.
Well, why didn't you say so!\nDoctor is in Hawkeye's hiding place. If you are who you say you are, you probably know where it is.
Thank you.
Hello, brother.
Could you tell me more about this place?

This is the road to the Zone. If I were you, I wouldn't get too close to the army outpost or let those soldiers see you: they've got orders to shoot on sight. Further up to the North there is a broken bridge, but they've set up an outpost there, too. Open areas are crawling with wild dogs, so it's not a safe place for rookies. Oh, and a pack of mutants shows up every now and then.
What about the soldiers at the bridge? I've got to get past them somehow.

Alright, you've got two options. If Kuznetsov is on duty, keep in mind that he is quite fond of money. Good chance he'll let you through for a bribe. But if you're low on cash or if it's someone else's shift, there is a different way. Go on the left side of the bridge, along the railway. Just make sure they don't see you! You'll come upon a small tunnel, it goes through the embankment. And another thing: you might also land a date with some zombies down there.
What's further up North, beyond the army outpost?
The Dump, that’s what. Now there's a depressing place. So much contaminated shit in some spots that swimming would be easier than walking.
Hello, mate. Wolf has already sent word of you. You got any more questions?
Yes. How many bandits in the camp?

Seven or eight people. Two by the gate, two more in the building to the right, near the fire, and another two in the one to the left - that's where they're keeping Nimble. Someone usually hangs around the yard as well. That's just about it. Shall we say a prayer and go?
Let's go. Rouse your men.
No. We'd make too much noise. I'll go on my own.
Well, do as you please. Shout if something is up... To hell with you, Rambo wannabe!
We went hunting and hunt we did. I bet Wolf will be pleased.
There's more of 'em! Find the bastards and take them down!
Whoa, man! Now that was something! You wiped them out and left nothing for us. I'd never believe it if I hadn't seen it with my own eyes! That blew me away, man…
So, where are the piles of enemies you killed? You talk the talk, but you don't walk the walk. Get lost!
Sorry, brother, but could you bugger off somewhere else? I'm here to meet someone...
I've got a couple of questions.
OK, ask away.
What can you tell me about the Zone?

That's all you wanna know? Take a week off and then come back to see me. Look, my time ain't cheap and I'm kinda busy right now. Here are the basics and then you're on your own.\nAbout three kilometers North of here, you'll find the Dump. That's the place they used to dump all the radioactive waste from the station. High radiation levels, anomalies all over the place, so there are loads of artifacts to be found there... but not very valuable. Just beware of the gangs and don't cross the Duty patrols. West of the Dump is the former Agroprom R&D Institute. Little in terms of artifacts there, so you can skip it. And to the East, there's the Dark Valley. Who knows... That's a pretty weird place. It seems quiet enough, apart from a bunch of gangsters roaming around. But I got a feeling there's more to it than meets the eye. Oh, and there's the Rostok factory, right beyond the Dump. That's stalker territory. You'll find lots of clued-up folks there, they'll tell you the rest.
I've changed my mind. Thanks.
Thanks. \nOK, now I'm listening very carefully.
Trader told me you might know something about Hawkeye.

Why is everyone taking such a keen interest in him lately? OK, I can't say I've known him personally. We did "communicate" though: my guys took some shots at him once. No one got hurt - it was clear his party had been waiting for someone else, so we parted in peace. Cussed each other out across a ravine and went on our separate ways. Grey, my brother, is now in the hangar at the Dump - I'll dish you his co-ordinates so you two can have a chat. He knows more about Hawkeye. \nBe careful at the exit – a small gang has settled down in those parts. By the way, I got a few monsters chasing me and it doesn't look like they've given up yet. You mind helping me deal with them? Walk in the park, really.
Thanks for the info, I appreciate it.
A medkit! Gimme a medkit!
Here you are.
Don't have one. Sorry.
Hey, mate, you saved me twice, and that's not something I forget. Take this... that's all I got!
Thank you.
Our boss here wanted to see you. But that doesn't make you a welcome guest. Keep moving.
Wait, Marked One! Right now, no one at the camp is gonna to talk to you.
Why?
What kind of idiot would like to chat with a former passenger of the "death truck"? First, you gotta prove you're ok to deal with.
What "death truck?" What are you talking about?

Ah, hell knows what it really is. But whatever it is, it's bad, about as bad as it gets... \nWhy am I talking to you about this, anyway! Maybe I'm just superstitious, but you, Marked One, should really take a hike, before something happens to you.
What can I do to make people believe me?
Pass Trader's test while we watch. If you're alright - if you're not trigger-happy and you use your head right - then we'll definitely find some common ground, don't you worry.
Alright, so be it.
Hello, Marked One. What do you want?
What's up, Marked One, how are you doing! We could really use some help.
Go on.

I'm Fanatic, and I'm filling in for the leader since Wolf left. A few Mercs came by here yesterday... and they were some tough bastards, let me tell you. They come here and start making serious demands: you've got one day, like, to clear this camp out - that's gonna be our new base. Tonight they're coming back, and as you can imagine, they won't be in the mood for a chat.
So, what are you going to do?

We're gonna set up an ambush, 'cause a direct attack would probably be the end of us. They've got the fighting gear and everything, plus they're trained in tactics like you don't wanna know. And all we've got here are little boys. So, we've decided to just sit tight in these houses, make it look like we're gone. Then, when the right moment comes, we attack. Fighters like you are just the thing we could use right now. And we'd make sure to thank you properly after it's all over. You know we're good for it! So, what do you say, will you help us out?
I will.

Let's spend the rest of the time preparing for the fight. Here's the plan: I'll put the most hopeless rookies in houses and basements and tell them not to make a move – otherwise they might just slaughter our own troops. You and me and a couple other decent shots will take the best positions to have an eye on the area around the fire. As soon as they come close to the fire, we let the bullets fly from everywhere! They'll be coming from the bridge... and I think we won't have to wait long. So, find yourself a hiding place with a view, then wait for my command. Take a look around, but remember that your odds aren't as good in the open. It's your call.
OK.
No, I'm not ready yet.
That's a shame. We could really use a fighter like you. I guess we'll have to do it on our own…
Waiting for these boy scouts. I got a feeling they're just around the corner.
You're a real killer, Marked One! I wouldn't want to stand in your way. Ever!
Yup, something like that.
Here, I hope you won't forget about us. \nAnd by the way – a million thanks for the help. We saved the young ones, Marked One.
Hey, Marked One, great to see you!
Hello to you, too.
By the way, where did Wolf go to?

Oh, he got a message from a stalker who was passing by, packed his things, grabbed a box of dynamite and went deep in the Zone. I was just getting back in shape after the wounds I got at the Cordon, so he asked me to look after the kids.
I've got questions.
Go ahead, I'll try to help.
Thank you.
What do you know about the Zone?
I know many things. Be more specific.
What's in the center of the Zone?

Ahem, that's a question alright... Two years I've been looking for the answer! But I still haven't found a way to the center, at least not one I could take and come back alive. My friends and I tried to break through a couple of times. I barely made it back, but my friends - well, some did, some didn't... \nYou'll ask why we went there at all. We were chasing our dreams, trying to make them come true.
Can dreams come true?

There is this beautiful story about a Wish-Granting Machine. They say there is a spot in the center of the Zone where any desires can come true, no matter how bizarre. But you know what? I know for a fact there's lots of ways to kick the bucket in the center of the Zone, and I don't believe in the Wish-Granting Machine anymore. Don't take that risk. I wouldn't.
How did the Zone come to be?
There was another bang here, in 2006. That's how it came about. I know that's not a real answer. Except that very few know the whole truth, if anyone at all.
What brought you to the Zone?

I used to work in a mine before they closed it down. I had no money and nothing to look forward to. Then I heard some rumors about the fabulous riches hidden inside the Zone. I had some experience under my belt, so I thought "What the hell?". Can't say I've become rich, but some cash came my way, that's for sure. This is a typical story; most of us got here the same way.
What's the most dangerous thing in the Zone?

Difficult to say. There are so many dangers and surprises, you just can't run into all of them. There's more than enough for one person anyway. I got one toe bitten off by a flesh, my hair is falling out from the radiation, and half my leg got fried in a Scorcher... There things are real bad, mate. Another time I happened to come face to face with a bloodsucker – there's a meeting I'd like to forget. So, we can talk all we like, but until you've felt it on your own skin, you'll have no real idea. The only advice I can give is – beware. Everywhere and always.
Have you heard about a guy called Hawkeye?

I seem to remember he's one of the tough ones. Never actually met the man. Well, I haven't come close to the center in a while and all we get here is rookies. You should find someone who hangs out deep in the Zone and have a chat with him.
What do you know about "death trucks?"

I know nothing and that's fine by me, thank you! \nSorry, I know about your situation. Too much mysticism about it. You spend a month in these parts and you can't help but become superstitious for life, no choice. Dead people in the trunk, dead people behind the wheel... Who are they, where did they come from and why? I can only hope they didn't rise up from the grave.
Hi. Why are you here?
Hi.\nI need to see Nimble. Would you know where I could find him?

Nimble got a raw deal. His group was attacked by some bandits a little ways from here. All he could do was send me an SOS message. It looked like his pals went under. My guys told me these bastards are now at the old bus depot, the one across the road.
You don't rescue your own people from prison? Not what I would call friendly. Or is it just you are too weak to do it?

I'd bop you one, but what's the use? It's not that simple. I got too few people, and even those I got are mostly rookies. I can't take that risk. If we lose this camp, things will get even worse for all the stalkers out there. And what about yourself? If you aren't too scared, I won't let my pride make me say no to a helping hand. So, will you help me deal with these thugs?
Think I could do it alone?
Nah, you stand no chance on your own. My scouts are good soldiers and right now they're right behind those freaks. Together you can make a run for it. What do you think? You got the guts?
I'll try.
Way to go! Alright, here's ammo and guns, also I gave you the guys' coordinates. I'll let them know about you right now.
I got the guts, but I won't go.
Yeah, like hell you do. Fine, you can shove off now!
So, how is it going?
Your guys and I made it a-ok at the bus depot.
That's awesome, mate! Here, take this – that's my personal reward for you.
We went over the bus depot with a fine-toothed comb. It's all clear now.
Wow! My men tell me you gave them a real beating! Here, take this money... Just a memento, not counting our huge gratitude. Plus, I got something else for you here...
Hey.
I'm working on it.
Keep me posted, ok?
I can't waste time on idle chit-chat. Take a hike.
I got that, I'm not stupid.
Hello, Marked One. What's the occasion?
Tell me something new, stalker.
What can I tell you. There were bandits at the bus depot, so we did some cleaning up. That's about it.
You aren't the bragging kind, are you! Look, since you've dealt with these thugs, I can't just let you go like that...
Thanks, brother! You did us a great service! I don't even know how to thank you...
Listen, I need that flash drive you were taking to the Trader. Do you have it?
Yeah, I got it... Those morons can't even do a proper search. Well, what the heck, take it! After all, you saved my life. It was well hidden, but these thugs can't frisk for shit.
Thanks. Where did you keep it anyway? Who knows, might come in handy.

I didn't keep it down THERE, don't sweat it. I've worked for Trader for a long time, I can store information safely! By the way, I told the thugs a nice little story about a cache full of artifacts and they ordered one guy to go there. The cache exists, but it's only got one artifact. I can give you its coordinates if you want.
Have a safe trip, stalker!
Sure, thanks.
But don't forget: there's lots of wild animals there. Besides, the gangster they sent is armed with more than a scoop and a shovel, so be careful. Thanks, man.
Thanks to you, too.
Sure, no problem. Good luck!
Mission complete. Here's the box from the army outpost.

Good man! You were a great help. But, of course a "thank you" won't buy you a piece of bread. Here's three... wait, two thousand pieces of eight and we're square! \nBy the way, the soldiers will certainly notice something missing – things are going to heat up. You better get going, and the faster, the better.
Got any special missions for me?
Nope, not a thing.
What special missions? You haven't even finished the last one!

Well, here's the deal… A box containing the reports made by an expedition that went deep North into the Zone has been taken to the army outpost. By day, it's guarded as if it was filled with pure plutonium, but for some reason at night they only leave two guards.
Go on.
Sneak into the outpost quietly and "recover" the box. Do that and I'll pay you anything…within reason. Will you do it?
I'll try.
I'll get the cash ready - you haven't let me down once, have you Marked One? Just one other thing... keep it low profile, eh? If the military get pissed off we're all in for a lot of trouble.
No, I can't take it on yet.
C'mon man, it's not as bad as it sounds. A bunch of drunk recruits green as grass with a single NCO…Well, OK, but I was really counting on you, Marked One…
Hey, Marked One, I've thought about this for a while and I want to offer you something… At the end of the day, you want to find Hawkeye, right?
Let's assume I do.

Well, I found out a bit about this Hawkeye guy. First of all, he exists. They say he found the road to the North of the Zone, to untouched fields...a real treasure trove...mmm, yeah... \nSo, here's the deal: I'll help you find him but it ain't no free lunch, you'll have to work for it. On the other hand there's something in it both of us - you whack this Hawkeye of yours and find out what happened to you while I find... Ekhm, I mean I'll get something out of our little venture too. You game?
Go on.

One look at you tells me you're a real man. We need people like you. \nWe're planning a little sortie with a few other traders. We want to go North into the center of the Zone but something or someone is blocking the way. God knows how this Hawkeye of yours managed to slip through... There's this place with something that makes brains boil! Horrible shit... But anyway, the lads who downed that chopper have been tracking the military nearby. By the looks of things, the army boys have found something in the Institute building and it's likely to be something important. I reckon it's got something to do with the center of the Zone. Anyway, everything the military found is stored on the second floor and it's guarded pretty well, as you can imagine. We really need it though. You follow?
I think so.
As soon as you leave the Institute area with the loot, take it to the Barman. He runs the business in the stalker joint called the 100 Rads bar by the Rostok factory.
Gotcha.

I'll upload the co-ordinates and the info you need to your PDA. Let me talk you through it: go North through the Dump and then turn West. A couple of kilometers further you'll find the Institute. By the way, the Dump is full of artifacts but the radiation levels are pretty rough, so you might wanna buy some antiradiation drugs or vodka from me. You don't want to light up like a Christmas tree do you...ha-ha? Just kidding mate, good luck to you!

Well, I've got this little problem, Marked One. Some of my boys were coming back from a mission and disappeared. One of them - a guy called Nimble - was bringing me some info... They disappeared right here somewhere because they missed the bridge. I don't know whether they decided to sell the info to someone else or maybe they're just getting pissed somewhere. Anyway, find Nimble. Dead or alive doesn't really matter, but the important thing is his flash drive. Bring it to me. Nimble was one of Wolf's lads. You can find Wolf here in the camp. Ask him, he's bound to know something.
Is that it?
Hey Marked One, what's up?
Marked One, what are you doing here? I told you to find Nimble!
So, you paid X18 a visit? Got the documents?
Yeah. Here they are.

Well, well... I see... Now that's interesting, very interesting! If I told anyone they wouldn't believe me! Hmm... Yeah... Oh! Would you just look at that! I didn't expect this... it's pretty bad, eh... Well, here take these back and give them to the Barman. Oh, and I owe you for your efforts.

Wait. Here, take this pistol and ammo. You won't last two seconds in the Zone without a weapon! By the ,way when you were brought here, you had a knife. I took it off you just in case your head wasn't quite working. You look OK though, so here it is.
Thank you.
So Marked One, any progress on our mutual business?

OK, there are two ways this thing can go. Either I talk you through a few boring things like I always do with rookies or I can just give you a mission like I do with experienced stalkers. Your choice.
Hey, Marked One! Good timing, I've got a little job for you.
Treat me like a rookie, I don't remember shit.
Just give me a mission.

Well, I've got this little problem, Marked One. Some of my boys were coming back from a mission and disappeared. One of them - a guy called Nimble - was bringing me some info... They disappeared right here somewhere because they missed the bridge. I don't know whether they decided to sell the info to someone else or maybe they're just getting pissed somewhere. Anyway, find Nimble. Dead or alive doesn't really matter, but the important thing is his flash drive. Bring it to me. Nimble was one of Wolf's men. You can find Wolf here in the camp. Ask him, he's bound to know something. He should help you with guns and ammo.
Go on.
That's all for now. Bring me the flash drive and we'll consider that you've partially paid me for saving you.\n
OK, I'll try.
Hey, Marked One. Glad to see you alive.
Greetings, Marked One! Did you manage?
I did. Here's the artifact.
Great, Marked One. One more little favor and we're even.
What favor?
The situation has become clear.
Where's the flash drive with the info?
Here it is.
Great.
I don't have it.
That's a pity, Marked One, a real pity. We can't talk business until you bring it to me…
Here, take it.
Good…We'll consider that you passed the test. I'd suggest you avoid going to the rookie camp.
Nothing yet.
So, did you bring the artifact?
Not yet.
Well, until you bring it, we've got nothing to talk about. Got it?
Marked One, I've told you everything already. Get outta here!
So Marked One, any news?
I need answers to a few questions.
Ask away but I don’t know everything. I sit here all day while life goes on outside, in the Zone. I can tell you about the Zone in general and a little about the nearby areas where I've been myself.
Tell me about the Zone in general.
Ask away.
What does the army do in the Zone?

They guard and protect, what else? No one really knows whether they're guarding the Zone or protecting the rest of the world from it. Sometimes they send whole expeditions here to look for something... \nBut I'll tell you something: they don't respect the Zone and the Zone doesn't like them either, so as often as not they return home in body bags. What else is there? Well, they look down at everyone and act like gods or something. They have no respect for stalker rules and won't ever help you even if you're dying right in front of them. They'll gladly shoot you themselves tho', and they don't get reprimanded for that... I've got a few contacts among them...you know, people always need vodka and...umm, magazines, right? Don't annoy them - they'll whack you for nothing.
Tell me about the Zone.

The Zone... You see, it's not just a circle a few kilometers in diameter with a nuclear power plant in the center. It's something bizarre. Really bizarre. I doubt anyone in the world could give you a straight answer. I feel the Zone isn't even part of this world. It's a different, detached world – weird and dangerous... and bloody attractive, too. And you know why? Because with a little luck anyone can get rich quickly. And the closer you come to the center of the Zone, the higher you will climb on the money ladder.
What's so dangerous about this "different world"?

Hrm... Not a whole lot, except you can croak any second and not know what hit you. A dumb soldier's bullet is the least of your problems, although they've pulled in a lot of military in here. Getting shot is basically the most painless kind of death in the Zone. Anomalies – now that's something for you... To die in an anomaly is a terrible thing indeed. Even mutants try to keep away from them. By the way, mutants, these "children of the Zone," are another kind of trouble, so don't go anywhere unarmed. And anyway, to learn about the other dangers, just ask other stalkers.
How does one get rich around here?

Gee, mate, what do you think? You don't remember?!\nArtifacts – that's the most important thing here. All sorts of weird toys that come from the Zone are worth a fortune in the Big Land. Artifacts are more precious than gold, diamonds or pure plutonium. Why? Because no jewelry in the world can give you the supernatural powers that the artifacts possess. Just imagine: you can hang a little gadget on your belt that makes bullets swerve by and never hit you! What else? Well, you can find bits and pieces even right here. For the most valuable pieces though, you'll have to get closer to the center.
Does anyone know what's happening in the center of the Zone?

It's a different tale every time you hear it. It's a bunch of fairy tales... except I don't believe all that otherworldly nonsense. The one thing I do believe is that the center of the Zone contains a lot of valuable artifacts. Only I haven't met anyone who went there and managed to come back alive.
Do you know what happened to me?

What kind of question is that, mate? You see, that's some murky business... \nThey found you in a "death truck," that's a... a kind of corpse carrier, right? These trucks come in from the center of the Zone once in a while, loaded with bodies. No one really knows where they are headed. So, one of them crashed into something and you were found nearby. This is the most amazing thing of all. We've found broken-down corpse carriers before, but no one ever came out of them alive. I'm sorry, bro, that's all I can help you with. The rest you'll have to figure out for yourself.
Who is Hawkeye?

Yeah, I've heard of a stalker by that name. Rumors say he's one of the few who went to the center of the Zone and made it back. Still, we got so many of these legendary stories about stalker heroes that I can't really guarantee anything. At any rate, I've never dealt with him personally – it seems he has his own trading channels. Anyhow, just ask the folks here in the Zone and you'll be sure to learn a lot more.
Who is this Ghost stalker?
Heh, that's another local legend. \nWe haven't had any news from him in a long while. I suppose he perished somewhere deep in the Zone.
What's going on in this neighborhood?

Huh! This is the entrance to the Zone, a sort of an antechamber. We've got an army cordon here. It's relatively quiet, with the exception of a couple of army guys who like to have some fun, go on shakedown runs. Experienced stalkers don't come by very often, so it's mostly rookies. Some settle here for good, yeah... A little ways from here there's a farm made into a rookie camp. Watch yourself though, they aren't afraid to pull the trigger when push comes to shove. \nWhat else? You won't make huge profit here, that's for sure. There's a deserted factory across the road. To the North, behind the railroad embankment there are the ruins of a farm. An army outpost lies to the South of here. And beware: the military left some mines in the ground. Also, there used to be a bridge in the center, but it went down somehow. That's about it, really.
Tell me more about the army outpost.

The few soldiers there have been ordered to shoot on sight, so you'd better walk around it and try not show your ass. If you piss them off, they may call for the Spetsnaz from the further cordon. Those guys can brew up such shit that I won't have any customers for a month... I know the commander a bit: he likes to take a swig as much as the next man. I'm only hanging on here thanks to him.
I want to know more about the fallen bridge.

That's just a couple of minutes North of here – you'll see it right away. There used to be a bridge over the road, but then it collapsed during one of the blowouts. The army lads built a checkpoint there and don't let anyone through... but if you grease the right palm, you'll pass with no problems. In general, you don't want to show your face there too much, unless you're badly wounded or got a heavy load on you.
Got some more info about the factory?

Cross the road and you'll see a brick building - that's it. Everything worth stealing has already been stolen, just this one box is left. This is the bandits' favorite place. I don't know if they are there now, but watch out just in case. You got nothing valuable on you to take, but do you really wanna go through all that?
Tell me about the farm.
You're getting boring, you know that? It's just a farm like any other. The place used to thrive before democracy broke out.
Thanks, that's all.
I'd like to find out more.
Tell me about this place.

Huh! This is the entrance to the Zone, a sort of an antechamber. We've got an army cordon here. It's relatively quiet, with the exception of a couple of army guys who like to have some fun, go on shakedown runs. Experienced stalkers don't come by very often, so it's mostly rookies. Some settle here for good, yeah... A little ways from here there's a farm made into a rookie camp. Watch yourself though, they aren't afraid to pull the trigger when push comes to shove. \nWhat else? You won't make huge profit here, that's for sure. There's a deserted factory across the road. To the North, behind the railroad embankment there are the ruins of a farm. An army outpost lies to the South of here. And beware: the military left some mines in the ground. Also, there used to be a bridge in the center, but it went down somehow. That's about it, really.
OK, thanks.
Tell me more about the army outpost.

The few soldiers there have been ordered to shoot on sight, so you'd better walk around it and try not show your ass. If you piss them off, they may call for the Spetsnaz from the further cordon. Those guys can brew up such shit that I won't have any customers for a month... I know the commander a bit: he likes to take a swig as much as the next man. I'm only hanging on here thanks to him.
I want to know more about the fallen bridge.

That's just a couple of minutes North of here – you'll see it right away. There used to be a bridge over the road, but then it collapsed during one of the blowouts. The army lads built a checkpoint there and don't let anyone through... but if you grease the right palm, you'll pass with no problems. In general, you don't want to show your face there too much, unless you're badly wounded or got a heavy load on you.
Got some more info about the factory?

Cross the road and you'll see a brick building - that's it. Everything worth stealing has already been stolen, just this one box is left. This is the bandits' favorite place. I don't know if they are there now, but watch out just in case. You got nothing valuable on you to take, but do you really wanna go through all that?
Tell me about the farm.
You're getting boring, you know that? It's just a farm like any other. The place used to thrive before democracy broke out.
I'm ok... bleeding all over though. Gimme a medkit, will ya?
Thanks, brother!
Here you are.
Thanks, friend. A little longer and I'd… I owe you one.
What the hell happened?

We were coming back from a scouting raid... Came across some gangsters. One of our guys got killed right there. They grabbed Nimble 'cause he made up a nice story about a cache full of artifacts. Me, I played dead and that saved my ass.
I need to see Nimble... I'm going after him. Wanna keep me company?
Oh, man... Right now I'm as good a fighter as a pair of old socks. I gotta get some of my strength back and return to the camp. I'll let the people know how much you helped me! Thanks again.
OK, you do that. Get well.
Sorry, mate. Ain't got a medkit.
Search the bodies... Our guys must have had some... gotta be there somewhere.
Not too good, but I'll live. Damn, why haven't I saved up enough to buy a bulletproof vest. Takes a fool to go deep inside the Zone without one.
Oh, damn, the pain is too much... I'm dying...
You alive?
Ugh…
You alright?
